column5: Does anybody know where I can order Pickerl Rigs over the internet or through a catalog ?
this guy sells them already made up. http://www.justfishontario.com/our_store.htmyou can buy parts and make your own from lots of different places. bass pro shops, cabelas, http://www.staminainc.com/
kevin, here's a good web site if you want to tie your own. http://www.walleyesinc.com/walleyeinc3/howtotie.html

Vitreum.....The Pickrel Rig Im looking for is solid wire and weighted at the bottom with two hooks attached directly on it. I fished with them years ago in Manitoba but cant find anybody who sells or makes them.

oops. sorry, thought you were talking about walleye spinner rigs. kinda sounds like an erie dearie, but they only have one hook. maybe someone else can help you. lots of experienced oldtimers here on this board.
be very carefull with these if you put them in your tackle box after you use them they will breed and infest your tackle box and entangle all your lures!!!!!!!

Kevin, try www.thefishinhole.com. They have them under the "Components" section of their catalogue, which you can view online. You can also shop online if you wish. They were listed at $.69 each.derrek."It's the weaseling out of things that sets us apart from the animals.... Except the weasel." - H.J. Simpson
Dont worry Butch I only plan on getting Female Rigs and I just hope they wont find my crankbaits to attractive.
